question.text: Read following statements and identify the incorrect one in regards to Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.

options.text: The allelic frequency in a population are stable and constant from generation to generation
Gene migration or gene flow is essential for the maintenance of Hardy - Weinberg principle
Evolution occurs when Hardy - Weinberg principle in disturbed
When frequency measured, differs from expected values, the difference indicates the extent of   evolutionary charge

solution.text: Gene migration or gene flow is one of the factors affecting Hardy-Weinberg principles.  When a population is following the principle and staying in equilibrium, it is not evolving. Thus, the allele frequencies will not change throughout different generations. Gene migration is movement of species out of a population or going into it causing change in the gene pool, thus breaking the equibrium. Gene flow does not help in maintaining the equilibrium.
